tool.name: bedtools AnnotateBed
tool.description: annotate coverage of features from multiple files
tool.command:
bedtools annotate -i '${inputA}' #if $names.names_select == 'yes': -files #for $bed in $names.beds: '${bed.input}' #end for
-names #for $bed in $names.beds: '${bed.inputName}' #end for #else: -files #for $bed in $names.beds: '$bed' #end for -names #for $bed in $names.beds: '${bed.display_name}' #end for #end if $strand $counts $both > '${output}'

param.label: Report the count of features followed by the % coverage for each annotation file
param.help: Default is to report solely the fraction of -i covered by each file

param.label: Report the count of features followed by the % coverage for each annotation file
param.help: Default is to report solely the fraction of the input file covered by each file
